programme.title: SA Safari Rally 25: Prologue
programme.desc: Prologue. This stage is just 30km from Sun City and will offer competitors a short special section of 24km of typical South African bushveld terrain, open grassy fields with trees, twin bush tracks with a short section in the forest.

programme.title: SA Safari Rally 25: Stage 1
programme.desc: Stage 1: Lichtenburg. This stage is about 200km west of Sun City and offers tracks and roads in and around the agricultural land as well as some sand tracks and open bushveld. tracks with a short section in the forest.

programme.title: SA Safari Rally 25: Stage 2
programme.desc: Stage 2: Barberspan. This stage will take you into the more open savanna areas with lots of fast open tracks and some off-piste section where navigation will be important.

programme.title: SA Safari Rally 25: Stage 3
programme.desc: Stage 3: Stella. This stage will be similar to stage 2 with open savanna areas with lots of dirt tracks and some more navigation.

programme.title: SA Safari Rally 25: Stage 4
programme.desc: Stage 4: Skilpadshek. The beginning of this stage is dirt tracks through the bush and then it becomes tight and rocky as it goes into the mountains.

programme.title: SA Safari Rally 25: Stage 5
programme.desc: Stage 5: Sun City. This stage is made up of hard pack cotton soil, which when its dry is very hard (no dust) but if it gets wet it is very slippery and difficult, there are a few river crossings and some gravel tracks.

programme.title: Formula E - Flashback
programme.desc: S24/E2 of 8 - London 2015. The 2015 Formula E London ePrix marked the season finale of the inaugural Formula E championship, where Nelson Piquet Jr. secured the Drivers Championship title by winning the race.

programme.title: Formula E - Flashback
programme.desc: S24/E3 of 8 - Buenos Aires 2016. Sam Bird claimed the first victory for the DS Virgin Racing partnership after fending off the charging Sebastien Buemi in Buenos Aires.

programme.title: Formula E - Flashback
programme.desc: S24/E4 of 8 - London 2016. Senna came out on top at in the Gfinity Arena in London, claiming bragging rights in the virtual extension of one of the most famous battles in motorsport.

programme.title: Formula E - Flashback
programme.desc: S24/E5 of 8 - Mexico City 2017. The 45-lap race was won by Audi Sport ABT driver Lucas di Grassi after starting from 15th position. Techeetahs Jean-Éric Vergne finished second and Virgin driver Sam Bird was third.

programme.title: Formula E - Flashback
programme.desc: S24/E6 of 8 - Montreal 2017. The first 35-lap race was won by Audi Sport ABT driver Lucas di Grassi from pole position. The Techeetah duo of Jean-Éric Vergne and Stephane Sarrazin finished in second and third places.

programme.title: Formula E - Flashback
programme.desc: S24/E7 of 8 - Punta Del Este 2018. At the 2018 Formula E Punta del Este ePrix, Techeetahs Jean-Eric Vergne placed first, forcing Lucas di Grassi and Alex Lynn into second and third.

programme.title: Formula E - Flashback

programme.title: El Clasico Moments: BAR v RMA 18/19
programme.desc: El Clasico Moments - Barcelona vs Real Madrid 2018/19. A celebration of footballs fiercest rivalry, El Clásico. From stunning goals to unforgettable drama, we revisit the clashes that defined generations and shaped legends.

programme.title: El Clasico Moments: BAR v RMA 21/22
programme.desc: El Clasico Moments - Barcelona vs Real Madrid 2021/22. A celebration of footballs fiercest rivalry, El Clásico. From stunning goals to unforgettable drama, we revisit the clashes that defined generations and shaped legends.

programme.title: El Clasico Moments: BAR v RMA 08/09
programme.desc: El Clasico Moments - Barcelona vs Real Madrid 2008/09. A celebration of footballs fiercest rivalry, El Clásico. From stunning goals to unforgettable drama, we revisit the clashes that defined generations and shaped legends.

programme.title: El Clasico Legends: Andres Iniesta
programme.desc: Andres Iniesta. Andres Iniesta Luján. A normal person that was capable of the extraordinary. A glorious career which was also built, in part, on magical performances in ElClásico.

programme.title: El Clasico Legends: James Rodríguez
programme.desc: James Rodríguez. James Rodríguez forced his way into Real Madrids history books by virtue of his footballing IQ, his magic on the ball and his ability to impress a hugely demanding fanbase.

programme.title: El Clasico Legends: Álvaro Arbeloa
programme.desc: Álvaro Arbeloa. Álvaro Arbeloa played a key role in Clásicos, where he was handed the unenviable task of defending the likes of Leo Messi, Neymar Jr, Alexis Sánchez or David Villa down his flank.

programme.title: El Clasico Legends: Gareth Bale
programme.desc: Gareth Bale. Gareth Bale played in LaLiga 11 Clásicos and 15 in total. And despite his numbers against Barcelona not being spectacular, he did score a memorable goal in the 2014 Copa del Rey final.

programme.title: El Clasico Legends: Ronaldinho
programme.desc: Ronaldinho. Ronaldinhos finest Clásico came on the 19th of November of 2005. Just one point separated both teams in the table, but the Brazilian proved that the gulf on the pitch was much greater.

programme.title: El Clasico Legends: Álvaro Arbeloa
programme.desc: Álvaro Arbeloa. Álvaro Arbeloa played a key role in Clásicos, where he was handed the unenviable task of defending the likes of Leo Messi, Neymar Jr, Alexis Sánchez or David Villa down his flank.
